TOOLING_REQUIREMENTS.NOTE: Make sure you follow the rules when performing tool calls - you must only use valid tools for editing and finding / replacing within files. Don't make tools up.

MANDATORY_TOOL_USAGE.NOTE: Below is a high level overview some of the useful tools you have available, you may have more at your disposal and should make effient use of tools to help completing tasks

TOOL.name: fetch_url
TOOL.WHEN: Needing to fetch content from a URL

TOOL.name: [ resolve_library_id , get_library_docs ]
TOOL.WHEN: Researching or implementing complex packages / libraries
TOOL.PURPOSE: Use these tools to access up to date documentation and implementation patterns for packages. Especially useful when implementing complex or recently updated packages or frameworks

TOOL.name: search_packages
TOOL.PURPOSE: To get the latest stable versions to use

TOOL.name: internet_search
TOOL.WHEN: Searching for internet for information or solutions not found in existing tools
TOOL.PURPOSE: Perform web searches to find relevant information, documentation, or solutions

TOOL.name: think
TOOL.WHEN: Encountering complex problems or requiring intermediate reasoning
TOOL.PURPOSE: Document thought process and solve complex issues
TOOL.ESCALATION: Use 'think harder' if standard thinking insufficient

BEST_PRACTICES.PRACTICE: Always consider available MCP tools before manual or guessed approaches
Tool use is preferred for efficiency and accuracy
